title: If you don't pay your tax bill

details.description: If you don't pay your tax bill, HM Revenue & Customs will choose a way to make you pay - find out what they can do
details.alternative_title: If you ignore your tax bill
details.body:
HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) will take ‘enforcement action’ to get the money - you may be able to avoid this if you contact them.

There are a number of ways HMRC can get the tax you owe. These are called ‘enforcement actions’.

They can:

  • ask debt collectors to get the money from you
  • collect what you owe through your wages or pension (if you owe less than £3,000)
  • take things you own and sell them (if you live in England, Wales or Northern Ireland) - this is called ‘distraint’
  • take you to court
  • make you bankrupt or close down your business

HMRC has further guidance on enforcement actions.

Avoid enforcement action

Contact HMRC as soon as you can - you may be able to either:

  • get more time to pay
  • pay in instalments
